item.title: Warcraft III
item.dc:creator: @Nerice Nerice
item.description:
@Nerice wrote:

Then its something on your end unless it was a really sucky torrent to begin with. Then again, if its a sucky torrent, find or add better trackers, or remove the sorry trackers while keeping the better ones…

You might want to look into private trackers as well, most enforce a ratio, but its well worth it. Especially since I always seed to a 3.0 ratio at least anyway…

I hate waiting too, but when my connection speed is maxed most of the time, well, If I want a shorter wait, I can pay for a better connection lol.

Sadly takes me about 1.5 hours to download a movie, and due to CPU speed takes me another 3 hours (usually around twice as long as it takes to download it) to convert it and burn it to a DVD. Talk about a wait.

Read full topic

item.title: Warcraft III
item.dc:creator: @Nerice Nerice
item.description:
@Nerice wrote:

Take your pick…

http://www.google.com/search?hl=en&q=bittorrent+client&btnG=Search

uTorrent, Azureus, BitComet, ABC are the best clients currently IMO. Personally use uTorrent myself.

Search google for torrent sites with it (ie TorrentBox, ISOHunt, thepiratebay, torrentz, Mininova etc…), or for the game or search google for torrent search engines like torrentspy etc…

I mainly use torrents for movies and burn them to dvd’s, dont mess with games much so dont know the best torrent sites for them. Although I can say, ANYTHING (Apps, Games, Movie, TV Shows, Albums) I have ever wanted to download and get, I got…

The files will probably be in .daa or .iso file formats since its a game/app your wanting, if so use PowerISO. Can d/l it from thier site and get a crack/serial off net, or get either/both of them off torrents too.

Almost all torrents you can read the comments to see if it works, has a virus etc… Virus Scan everything anyway though…

Some people dont like torrents, almolst all that dont like them talk about the speed. If your getting slow speeds look for extra trackers to add, your configuration of the client and/or windows itself. I always almost max my bandwidth out when using torrents (150 kb/s down max, and I average 138 kb/s down at least usually…), to the point at times it takes forever to load a webpage because its all used up (its configurable so you can limit the bandwidth used total by the torrents or limit bandwidth per torrent that is active etc… Every once and a while you cant get a decent speed no matter what, but even then usually at least 40 kb/s down.

Read full topic
